itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Oliver James Morris (fourth ¼ 1916 – 20 September 1944) was a Welsh rugby union and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s and 1940s. He played club level rugby union (RU) for Llanelli RFC and Pontypridd RFC, and representative level rugby league (RL) for Wales, and at club level for Hunslet, Castleford (Heritage № 225 as a wartime guest) and Leeds, as a stand-off, i.e. number 6.

response: *20 September - Oliver Morris, rugby player and footballer, 27 (killed in action)
* Oliver Morris (1916–1944), Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

link_mentions.page: List of Leeds Rhinos international players
response: * Oliver Morris won caps for Wales while at Hunslet, and Leeds 1938…1941 5-caps

Pontypridd RFC flyhalf Oliver Morris lodged at a house in Rosser Street, Maesycoed before he 'went North' and signed for Hunslet in November 1937, with team mate Emlyn Walters, who went on to Captain Pontypridd RFC from 1937 to 1939, before he too turned professional with Bradford Northern in July 1939. Walters was an outstanding player in the great Bradford Northern team of this era. His career was interrupted in 1944 when he was called up to the Royal Navy in the second world war where he served as a Chief Petty Officer
* Oliver Morris won caps for Wales while at Hunslet, and Leeds in 1938…1941 5-caps
